alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Lyon; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued August 22 at 2:21PM CDT until August 25 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions heat index values reaching 105 to 115 degrees. Some locations in east-central Kansas will see heat indices around 120 degrees this afternoon. * WHERE...Much of east-central Kansas. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working outdoors or participating in outdoor activities, and those without access to quality air conditioning.
info.instruction: An Excessive Heat Warning means that a prolonged period of dangerously hot weather is expected, during which heat illnesses are likely. Postpone any non-essential outdoor activities during the midday and afternoon. Stay in an air-conditioned building and check up on relatives and neighbors. If you must venture outside, drink plenty of water, wear light and loose fitting clothing, and reduce strenuous activities. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
